ticket.title: Single Table Inherited model generator
ticket.original-body:
If I have to generate a model (and its associated unit test) which inherited from another model (sti), i have to use model generator with two options and to manually modify generated model.
This generator create a simple class which inherit from its parent: @@@ script/generate sti_model car vehicule @@@ will generate the following model: @@@ ruby class Car < Vehicule
end @@@
Patch contains both documentation and test. It applies cleanly on master and 2-3-stable branches.
ticket.latest-body:
If I have to generate a model (and its associated unit test) which inherited from another model (sti), i have to use model generator with two options and to manually modify generated model.
This generator create a simple class which inherit from its parent: @@@ script/generate sti_model car vehicule @@@ will generate the following model: @@@ ruby class Car < Vehicule
end @@@
Patch contains both documentation and test. It applies cleanly on master and 2-3-stable branches.
ticket.original-body-html:
If I have to generate a model (and its associated unit test) which inherited from another model (sti), i have to use model generator with two options and to manually modify generated model.

This generator create a simple class which inherit from its parent:


script/generate sti_model car vehicule

will generate the following model:


class Car < Vehicule

end

Patch contains both documentation and test. It applies cleanly on master and 2-3-stable branches.

version.body:
If I have to generate a model (and its associated unit test) which inherited from another model (sti), i have to use model generator with two options and to manually modify generated model.
This generator create a simple class which inherit from its parent: @@@ script/generate sti_model car vehicule @@@ will generate the following model: @@@ ruby class Car < Vehicule
end @@@
Patch contains both documentation and test. It applies cleanly on master and 2-3-stable branches.
version.body-html:
If I have to generate a model (and its associated unit test) which inherited from another model (sti), i have to use model generator with two options and to manually modify generated model.

This generator create a simple class which inherit from its parent:

script/generate sti_model car vehicule
will generate the following model:
class Car < Vehicule







end

Patch contains both documentation and test. It applies cleanly on master and 2-3-stable branches.
version.title: Single Table Inherited model generator

version.body: I like this. I'm constantly forgetting to turn off the migration and the fixture in the regular model generator.
version.body-html: I like this. I'm constantly forgetting to turn off the migration and the fixture in the regular model generator.
version.title: Single Table Inherited model generator

version.body:
This looks good to me, but I think the names should be:
script/generate model_subclass Foo Bar
And the usage should name those things Subclass and Parent
Make those changes, upload the patch and I think we're good to go!
Nice simple enhancement, good work.
version.body-html:
This looks good to me, but I think the names should be:

script/generate model_subclass Foo Bar

And the usage should name those things Subclass and Parent

Make those changes, upload the patch and I think we're good to go!

Nice simple enhancement, good work.
version.title: Single Table Inherited model generator

version.body:
I renamed it to model_subclass and modified documentation and tests.
Thanks !
version.body-html:
I renamed it to model_subclass and modified documentation and tests.

Thanks !
version.title: Single Table Inherited model generator

version.body:
(from [2cb60abfecbad78046b0afde156c72a9ae766cf0]) Add an model_subclass generator.
This generator creates a new model as a subclass of an existing model and the unit test for that model. Lets users avoid having to manually delete the fixtures and migration or remember to pass those arguments.
[#2702 state:committed]
Signed-off-by: Michael Koziarski <michael@koziarski.com> http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/2cb60abfecbad78046b0afde156c72a9ae766cf0
version.body-html:
(from [2cb60abfecbad78046b0afde156c72a9ae766cf0]) Add an model_subclass generator.

This generator creates a new model as a subclass of an existing model and the unit test for that model. Lets users avoid having to manually delete the fixtures and migration or remember to pass those arguments.

[#2702 state:committed]

Signed-off-by: Michael Koziarski michael@koziarski.com
http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/2cb60abfecbad78046b0afde156c72...
version.title: Single Table Inherited model generator

version.body:
Fabien e Koz,
I'm reworking on generators for GSoC. I'm currently planning to move model_subclass out and add a parent option:
script/generate model Car --parent=Vehicule
The main reason is, everyone can extend the model generator to add new behavior. If we have both model_subclass and model, plugin developers will have to extend both.
When a parent option is given, migration is not generated.
What do you think?
version.body-html:
Fabien e Koz,

I'm reworking on generators for GSoC. I'm currently planning to move model_subclass out and add a parent option:

script/generate model Car --parent=Vehicule

The main reason is, everyone can extend the model generator to add new behavior. If we have both model_subclass and model, plugin developers will have to extend both.

When a parent option is given, migration is not generated.

What do you think?
version.title: Single Table Inherited model generator

version.body: Sounds good to me, so long as the result is the same a --parent option could be just as nice (if not nicer :))
version.body-html:
Sounds good to me, so long as the result is the same a --parent option
could be just as nice (if not nicer :))
version.title: Single Table Inherited model generator

version.body:
Koz,
The good think is that you can even use it in scaffold, since it will only delegate to the model generator:
script/generate scaffold Car --parent=Vehicule
It creates everything, except the migration.
And how the results could be even nicer? I'm listening! :)
Finally, do you think we need to add a deprecation warning to model_subclass? In theory, it was not released and it's not on the 2.3 stable as well.
version.body-html:
Koz,

The good think is that you can even use it in scaffold, since it will only delegate to the model generator:

script/generate scaffold Car --parent=Vehicule

It creates everything, except the migration.

And how the results could be even nicer? I'm listening! :)

Finally, do you think we need to add a deprecation warning to model_subclass? In theory, it was not released and it's not on the 2.3 stable as well.
version.title: Single Table Inherited model generator

version.body: This supra footwear is called a modern vintage and has been since their introduction in 2003 where they began in Europe. Every supra shoes has some type of ornament, adornment or hardware and is comprised of aged leather that is bought from around the world. These supra uk are culturally engaging and allow for the woman wearing them to be enveloped in luxury.With new cuts and styles and hand stitched shoes, these timberland boots, heels or flats will make every foot look like it stepped out of vintage Hollywood. This timberland shoes have been worn and coveted by many of the most famous females in recent history. One such coach outlet, Jennifer Aniston, wears them in public and at home.This company makes many different unique styles of bags outlet from ankle booties to sandals, pumps, moncler jackets online, platforms and wedges. One louis vuitton bag in particular is ideal for the gothic style sense; it is patent leather and laces up the front of the shaft. There are also zippers on each side, and this shoe offers a flat heel of a half inch.Another great moncler jackets sale is featured in People's Style Watch and is called a platform bootie. This ture religion jeans has a raised panel in front of the ankle as well as a heel that measures 4.5 inches. The front offers a leather bandage appearance and is considered high fashion.
